name: Hilton Santa Fe Historic Plaza

reviews.text: We recently stayed at the Hilton - location is great, short walk to the Plaza. Good room, clean and comfortable.
reviews.title: Great location - great hotel

reviews.text: We did not intend to stay here, but were "sold out" of Buffalo Thunder resort and needed a place to stay last minute. This is as good as any place in downtown at the price point, but it's still an expensive option compared with everything else in the vicinity. It's built for comfort, not for luxury.
reviews.title: Nothing Wrong With This Place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Here is my take of the entire Santa Fe lodging choices:
reviews.title: casitas are very nice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There are plenty of hotel options on Cerillo Ave (the road leading into town from ABQ) for less money. As long as you're not planning to drink heavily, you can easily stay at a newer property at a better value (Hampton looked okay; Hyatt looked great) - or stay north at Buffalo Thunder resort - because downtown is just too expensive for the value received and parking is readily available. Every hotel downtown was $200+/night and we checked out several hotels (including actually looking at rooms) before settling in at the Hilton downtown - ostensibly because we get HHonors points and the pool was huge.
reviews.title: A lot more customer service needed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I read many reviews and they are pretty much spot on. The staff here is great and truly goes out of their way to make your stay pleasant. The hotel itself is a historic property, but not a "grand old hotel", more like a dated Holiday Inn or a drive-in motel with the way the rooms sort of surround the courtyard/pool. There are no double-queen rooms, just "double-doubles" and that's my biggest complaint at this price point (and why it cannot be a 5 star).
reviews.title: Great Location, Great Loacation, Great Location

reviews.text: The swimming pool is the largest in the entire downtown district - great for swimming laps and with a real deep end for diving (although no board). Honestly, if I were having a wedding party or a small convention where everyone knew each other - this would be THE place.
reviews.title: Perfectly situated - walking distance to town

reviews.text: We wanted to stay in the historic district, which really paid off -- easy to walk everywhere. If you pick a hotel south of the downtown, you are in Anywhere USA with strip malls and nothing scenic nor out of the ordinary. In the downtown area, you can take in the shopping, dining and history without using your car. The staff, especially Suzanne and Brian, made us feel very welcome. You can tell they like where they work. Everyone we encountered was very professional and ready to serve. We enjoyed the large room, the pool and spa, and the kiva fireplace, which is poolside.
reviews.title: Great stay, great staff

reviews.text: Older hotel in a great location for downtown shopping and touring. Walking distance from most everything. Safe, secure parking lot. Friendly staff and hotel security. Dated room, but clean and well kept. I had a sliding glass door with a balcony overlooking the outdoor pool and hot tub. Guest were mannered and I didn't hear any noise from outside, even with keeping my sliding door open all night to enjoy the cool breeze of the outside air. The breakfast was disappointing. They must have been understaffed as many tables were unclean and there was a lack of food items on the buffet. Even the lobby at the main entrance of the hotel was enjoyable to sit and read or just watch people pass through. Highly recommend
reviews.title: Great place in the Plaza district

reviews.text: My husband and I recently traveled to Santa Fe for a wedding with our one-year old son. We didn't want to rent a car, so accessibility to the downtown was important. We were able to walk everywhere from the hotel including the Canyon Road section. When we arrived late at night after a long day of traveling, the desk clerk Brian told us our reservation through Expedia had been cancelled. Seeing the baby and our faces, he immediately told us not to worry and said he could get us a room. We ended up getting a better rate since I am military and we were in a room in no time. The hotel itself was lovely, with a spacious room big enough for the pack n' play they provided us. The only thing the room needed, for us anyway, was a refrigerator for my son's milk. We made due with the ice bucket. There is an outdoor pool if you go when it is warm enough. The daily breakfast buffet was included as part of our package and was wonderful: a mix of the staple hot foods (eggs, bacon, sausage, pancakes, french toast, oatmeal) as well as cereals, lots of fresh fruit (which was actually ripe and sweet), yogurt, bagels, toast, lox, fresh squeezed oj. It was such a pleasure each morning. What struck me most however, was how accommodating the staff was to our needs with a toddler. One night when it was raining and we didn't want to leave the hotel for dinner, they were serving in the bar area. Not wanting to disturb the other customers dinners, we asked if we could be served in an unused indoor courtyard area adjacent to the restaurant. They obliged and our waiter Jeff even cut off the crusts of the grilled cheese sandwhich and brought out some fruit for my son right after we ordered so he could eat right away (all without us asking.) Also, the last morning we stayed we had to catch an early flight and the shuttle was to pick us up at 6:30 am. The restaurant for breakfast opened at 6:30 so we would miss breakfast that day, but we asked the staff the day before and arranged it so we could eat at 6:15. We managed to catch the shuttle AND leave with a full stomach before our long day of travel. It was so above and beyond what I would expect a hotel chain to do. Would highly recommend staying here and would definitely stay there again should we return to Santa Fe.
reviews.title: Amazing service and great location.

reviews.text: I would recommend this hotel as a solid place to stay while visiting Santa Fe. Right near the Plaza. Not super high-end, but you'll have a good stay. Nice pool centered within the grounds -- they had a hard time supplying everyone with towels. Old TVs and no movies on demand -- wasn't so happy about that. Huge room, but super small bathroom -- don't get the reason for this. No room service. Hmmm, as I write this I'm seeing that there were some issues with the details of what make up a good stay vs. a just ok stay -- guess this would be a just ok stay. I did miss not having room service. Would I stay here again? Sure, I would. But, I also know what I'm getting into. My recommendation to the owner of this hotel would be to add some comforts that would help justify the price -- New TVs and room service being the top two.
reviews.title: Nice stay. Close to everything.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We travel quite a bit and stay at Hilton often. This was a very disappointing hotel for several reasons. First the outside of hotel is nothing special. Very plain. There was one person working the front desk and we had to wait longer than usual. In our room there was a huge stain of something on floor next to the bed. Didn't ask, didn't want to know. The air conditioner didn't work and even though they claim to have fixed it....we couldn't lower the temp. There was no wireless available except in the lobby. This is unacceptable in a hotel of this caliber. Yes, they internet access, but they charge you almost $10 per day. Really?? In the bathroom, the toilet was situated so that door was in the way when using the facilities. And we had to pay for parking in an outside insecure lot!! I would not stay at this hotel again.
reviews.title: Not what I expect from a Hilton

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our first stay in Santa Fe. We stayed at the Hilton for three nights. It is well located for accessing the main part of Santa Fe's Plaza but a fair walk to Canyon Road galleries. Our room was a premium king and was plenty large for our stay. The staff was always helpful. The negatives are that it is showing its age. The carpet under the cabinet for the refrigerator was grey with dust. I didn't bother looking under the bed! The furniture has that beat look to it. The pool always looked dirty and there was food and junk laying around the pool deck. However, the pool itself was heated and a very decent size. The restuarant and bar are on the small size for a Hilton. You pay for parking, of course. Our room was quiet and the floor was quiet. A large conference made the lobby area (which is small) noisy and crowed everytime we went through. On the Saturday that we were there, the dinning room and bar were closed for a private function all day. This seemed a bit strange to me. Overall this is an okay hotel but after wondering around Santa Fe, we found other places in the same price range that might be a better choice.
reviews.title: Good hotel but needs a little help

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nice and Clean, walking distance to everything Historic Dist. downtown
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: Structure is not being kept up, cracks in walls and facets, wallpaper ripped. Children allowed in hot ub even in the evening making it hard for adults to use. Hot tub closes at 10 - too early in my opinion.
reviews.title: $5 for a bottle of water- Outrageous.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After reading copious reviews on all the hotels near the Plaza, we finally decided to go for value with the Santa Fe Hilton. We were pleasantly surprised with the beautiful, spacious room we were given and the quality of the hotel decor. This is clearly an event location, as we observed two weddings in the ballroom while we were there, but we never heard any noise in our room. As we are Hilton Honors Gold members we received half price parking (available to all Hilton Honors members) and a free buffet breakfast each morning. The only downside was the small size of the bathroom; however, it had lots of counter space, which made up for the small space. There was no charge for the business center, and wifi was available as well. We loved the location, about 5 minutes from the heart of the Plaza, and found the price, even for a weekend, to be among the best. I would definitely stay here again. It may not have the Old World Charm of some of the other hotels, but it was lovely, comfortable, quiet, convenient, with excellent service.
reviews.title: Great Location - Great Value

reviews.text: Everyone at the hotel was very friendly and helpful. The location is excellent for traveling throughout the central and northern New Mexico areas.
reviews.title: Great fun

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Hilton in Santa Fe greeted us with nice rooms and a friendly staff. The hotel was booked full for a weekend of visitors and conventioners but the hotel staff were helpful despite the workload of human traffic entering the hotel. The rooms were quiet and we were able to open the sliding door and turn off the a/c units. The downtown area was surprisingly quiet with the window open. The convenient location made it easy to get around historic Santa Fe and the Plaza was just a short walk away! We enjoyed our stay and will choose this hotel again!
reviews.title: Nice Place-Nice People!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I read the reviews of this Hilton before we made the trip, and I had some concerns about its quality. There was no reason to be worried. It's a very standard Hilton with no surprises.
reviews.title: Standard Hilton

reviews.text: The choices for breakfast are great -- a large, complete breakfast buffet or a menu with standard breakfast fare or a cup of coffee and pastries down the hall in their small cafe. Fine choices for everyone.
reviews.title: Great location and nice rooms

reviews.text: When I made some suggestions at the front desk about the coffee maker in our room, they gave me free internet in our room for the week. Nice touch. When I asked for directions, I got some clear and snappy answers. That's all I need.
reviews.title: There are better places to stay for the $$

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As everyone knows from reading other reviews, the Hilton is only a few blocks from the Plaza which is handy. There is plenty of free parking, and a drive-through ATM right next door. I thought it was in a better location than other Santa Fe hotels I've stayed in.
reviews.title: Disappointed
Nice place at the Priceline "Name Your Own Price" rate
reviews.text: Booked with Priceline for a fair price. The $199 listed price would have been far too much for the quality of this hotel. The room was dated, but very clean. The bed and linens were very nice and the bathroom has been updated. One odd thing....the water pressure in our shower was like a fire hose! No complaints there...just seems odd in New Mexico to not have a low flow shower head. :) The best thing about this hotel is that it is within walking distance of downtown Santa Fe. We never moved our car from the parking lot ($15 parking fee). Overall, a very nice stay at the Priceline price. Couldn't have given it high marks otherwise.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were happy with our 1 night stay, especially with a Priceline rate. All hotels were full because of the busy art & opera weekend in Santa Fe.
reviews.title: Close to Plaza, Clean & Quiet

reviews.text: We usually stay at La Fonda on the Plaza, and will stay there over The Hilton if rooms are available. Though, we would still recommend this hotel for those wanting to be close to the plaza.
reviews.title: Awful

reviews.text: The room was big, linens soft, bathroom clean. $15 for parking. The swimming pool looked inviting, good for kids, and there is a nice outdoor fireplace with big comfy chairs for groups of people. The staff was pleasant, and check-in was smooth.
reviews.title: Don't pay the full price

reviews.text: From the lobby of the hotel to the plaza is a 2-3 minute walk. We walked to the art openings, to dinner and to breakfast.
reviews.title: dirty room but good location

reviews.title: Great location close to plaza, but rooms dated

reviews.text: The hotel is in an older historic building, lobby area, hallway to the Pinon Cafe breakfast room, and cafe were lovely. Rooms are large and spacious but older and dated. Could use a major renovation tom freshen them up. Bed and bedding were comfortable and our room was clean.
reviews.title: Good location, great staff, looks like a Holiday Inn

reviews.text: breakfast buffet had an excellent selection for both hot and cold foods. Service was excellent and friendly throughout.
reviews.title: Great hotel in a great location; a definite return trip merited

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Loved the ambiance and decor of the hotel, and the friendliness and helpfulness of the staff. The lobby has a pair of coolers in the afternoon and early evening, one containing water infused with fresh fruit and the other a fruit beverage, both complimentary, which made a refreshing welcome at check-in. The location of the hotel is great for exploring Old Town Santa Fe, and the parking fee was reasonable - just make sure you sign up for Hilton Honors (either in advance, or when you register), since that cuts your parking cost in half and gives you free internet.
reviews.title: BEST HOTEL IN SANTA FE

aka: Hilton Santa Fe Historic Plaza Hotel Santa Fe
description: Located just 2 blocks from the famous Historic Plaza, the Hilton is one of the best hotels in downtown Santa Fe. Not many hotels near Santa Fe, NM can compete with our excellent service and amenities.
